channel.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
channel.description:
![image|313x166](upload://9hflccviw0C8v9O00ru0dJGsiHN.jpg)
Just a quick culture tip ^ I've seen a few people trying to bait reactions with the Buddhist symbol (that existed _before_ the Nazi symbol).
Although this is a symbol of peace, we know what you're trying to do ;p pls don't bait. At the same time, if you _do_ see this and it's not tilted, you're technically being _blessed_ now that you know what it means!

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: Nerbins
item.description:
Maybe the community should come up with it‚Äôs own peace symbol. Not as a way to shut down Buddhists (Some live in my neighborhood and they are definitely the nicest people who live there. And everyone‚Äôs nice!), but as a way to prevent confusion between the two symbols and to still have a symbol of peace, even if it‚Äôs only in our community. I‚Äôm sorry if this counts as necrobumping, but I just wanted to offer a possible solution.

Read full topic

item.description:
LYNX:

Maybe I‚Äôm being a little bit sensitive here since I am a German myself but I still think you should not be able to write it in-game since no one will ever use it with the intention of the Buddhist meaning.

Oh, I agree ‚Äì we still suspend those people because we know what they‚Äôre trying to do. However, I was mostly posting this for educational purposes.

Read full topic

item.source: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
Let‚Äôs make some assumptions about Buddhists who want to spread peace:

  1. They know about World War 2 and Nazis
  2. They‚Äôre nice people
  3. They realise that, when someone sees that symbol, they think of Nazis first rather than Buddhists
  4. They don‚Äôt want to be mistaken for Nazis

With these assumptions we can logically conclude that a Buddhist would not use the symbol, therefore the only people using it are using it as a hate symbol and we ban it completely

Read full topic

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: Aquillion
item.description:
I think mods are smart enough to figure out the reason someone is using it.

(Spoiler: Buddhists and Hindus don‚Äôt randomly spam it everywhere - in fact, doing so would often be seen as offensive to them, since it‚Äôs mocking the symbol. Neo-nazis and trolls totally love spamming it everywhere. Therefore, if someone starts posting it in ToL or on the forums, they‚Äôre a Nazi or a troll. If you see it on someone‚Äôs Buddhist temple or on a huge-ass Buddhist statue, that‚Äôs fine.)

Read full topic
item.source: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
If we decide to let people off the hook just because they say ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a Buddhist I was just spreading peace‚Äù then literally everyone who uses it for racist purposes is gonna use that as an excuse

Read full topic
item.source: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Can you even cite an example of it being used right? I‚Äôm more than certain at least 1/4th of the game‚Äôs community is christian most likely, yet none of them have been compelled to spam üïÜ üïÜ üïÜ üïÜ‚Äôs into the chat, and why would they, again it does nothing to help the social deduction in the game, and there isn‚Äôt time for much social chat.

Whenever I‚Äôve seen a schwashtica used as a ‚ÄúBuddhist Symbol of Peace‚Äù, it‚Äôs not because the person expects anyone to interpret it in a positive way, but because the person explicitly is intentionally spamming until people start announcing they are upset and/or reporting him, then switch to the ‚Äúwhy are you offended by a symbol of peace‚Äù.

No matter the religion or concept, no one is unfamiliar and unaware with what the symbol currently makes people think of, and can ANYONE seriously say that they honestly believe anyone who has ever spent any time in a western country would post any kind of schwashtica with any intent other than to see someone get offended (regardless of whether people should or shouldn‚Äôt be offended by it, does anyone actually believe that anyone would paste it in without the specific goal of seeing someone get upset by it).

Read full topic
item.source: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: Dooku
item.description:
Why should Buddhists be punished because some people are complete ignorant idiots? Just ban anyone who uses it wrong. Simple.

Read full topic
item.source: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Dooku:

No one will ever? What about buddhists? If you prevent people from being able to use it it‚Äôs just another form of discrimination.

Here‚Äôs an easier thing‚Ä¶ this is a game with a really limited time table. It isn‚Äôt the place or the time that a productive discussion involving‚Ä¶ well really anything about your real world background fits. As many games as I‚Äôve played I‚Äôve never once had time for a productive discussion on who I am, where I‚Äôm from, what my belief or political prefrences are, my sexuality‚Ä¶ heck from my randomness of skins and names, in game my real world gender wouldn‚Äôt even be known, and again I see absolutely no good reason any of those things would be discussed.

Any productive or positive conversation involving any of those things, would usually be expected to take a few minutes, something of which this game is usually too fast paced to allow.

The rational simple rule, is just no symbols of real world ideologies at all‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs zero practical place for them, the game has it‚Äôs own fictional lore and groups which are certainly reasonable to refrence without bothering anyone.

Read full topic
item.source: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: LYNX
item.description:
Let‚Äôs be real here pal, I‚Äôve never seen a Buddhist using it. But I have seen people using it in a racist form. I think the Buddhist would know how their symbol is mostly used online, I think they would understand it if we banned their symbol since those using the symbol mostly do it to ‚Äúharm‚Äù other people.

Calling it discrimination is a little bit far stretched in my opinion here. Do we discriminate the Nazis in Germany since the Swastika is banned in Germany? Are we discriminating the Islamic religion by forbidding forced marriage?

Maybe asking a Buddhist themselves for their opinion would be good here.

Read full topic

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
yeah, sounds like another of the millions of ways people pick something out that they already know half the people are going to view it in an offensive way, but try and ignore it. Much like those who search for real world names that have the N word in them somewhere. It isn‚Äôt fooling anyone that the intent is to offend.

Read full topic

item.title: Buddhist Symbol of Peace vs Nazi Symbol of Hate
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
The point of this post is to jokingly explain that posting this is not allowed, and will likely see you suspended/banned.

All of the ‚Äúyou‚Äôre actually blessed‚Äù stuff is a humorous way to try and make those who deal with swastika spam feel better about it.

Read full topic
